channel.title: Setting up my own Webhost with Raspberry Pi
channel.description:
Hey, so today i bought my raspberry pi, for the guys that don't know what it is.
Its a mini Computer with 512 Mb Ram running linux
[img]http://static.trustedreviews.com/94%7C00002243c%7C16cd_RaspberryPi.jpg[/img]
Its small and perfect for hosting things. (And dont forgot Very very cheap) 35$
Anyways i have 2 problems.
1- If i got apache running with php and mysql on my webhost, how will i point my Domain to it?
2- Portforwarding, I'm not a noob in hosting things, normaly i only host my servers with vps, but long time ago i used to host them myself.
Anyways i opened some ports in my router "20,21,22,25,53,80,110,143" And when i check them, they are timed out... [img]http://gyazo.com/093af344f695d4447bfdefe5dd05c4d6.png[/img]
If i disable my Firewall and avast virus, they all close... (Wtf?) Anyways i hope you guys could help me with those stuff
-mitch

@silabsoft wrote:

didn’t jagex mention in some post that world 2 was running with plastic on the fan and heatsink for a few months

item.title: Setting up my own Webhost with Raspberry Pi
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:8, topic:478755”][quote author=RS PS link=topic=596977.msg4203944#msg4203944 date=1358637046]
Sorry to be off topic but can you run RSPS’s on them?
[/quote]

Off of one, barely. Would need a small cluster to keep from struggling.[/quote]
Not if the server was programmed well.

Read full topic

item.title: Setting up my own Webhost with Raspberry Pi
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:4, topic:478755”]You have to open ports on your router.

EDIT:
If you’re hosting a webserver, port 80 specifically.

Not sure why you’d want to do this with a pi anyway.[/quote]

Because it’s fun and you can make a cluster fairly easily and it’s pretty cheap.

Read full topic
item.source: Setting up my own Webhost with Raspberry Pi

Not sure why you’d want to do this with a pi anyway.

item.title: Setting up my own Webhost with Raspberry Pi
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

Ruby:

I’ve never used Raspberry Pi personally but this looks promising.

Thanks, this will solve my Dns problem

But now i’ve to figure problem 2… for raspberry Pi you have to open a few ports =/ and they doesn’t seem to work anymore :S

Read full topic
